result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornell S Preston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cornell S Preston is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cornell S Preston was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornell S Preston

records.addlTxt: Notice of intent to certify debt to the WI department of revenue returned undeliverable; unable to forward
DE's copy of 4/14/2022 STC Notice returned; unable to forward
Payment info returned to sender; not deliverable as addressed.

11:10 AM Defendant Cornell S Preston in court. Prosecuting Atty Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin. Judge talked with defendant off the record re: different options: 1) apply for SPD, 2) representing himself for trial or 3) representing himself to talk to ADA to work out a deal. CT finds DE has waived his right to Atty to talk to ADA re: deal. CT left courtroom for ADA Rennicke and DE to talk. Defendant ready to accept offer. 

Def entered a plea of no contest to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. CT sentenced DE to 3 days jail deemed served by jail credit. Court waives all waivable court costs.

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2.

A. Martinelli
Status conference on April 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at Arby's on Collins Ct in Madison. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

03:18 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Schuyler S Boggio.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
